thread.title: Lenovo Z2 Plus gets a price cut in India, now startign at Rs. 14,999
thread.title_full: Lenovo Z2 Plus gets a price cut in India, now startign at Rs. 14,999

author: Mitja Rutnik
title: Lenovo Z2 Plus gets a price cut in India, now startign at Rs. 14,999
text:
The Lenovo Z2 Plus was launched in India last September in two variants . The version with 3 GB of RAM and 32 GB of storage retailed for Rs. 17,999, while the 4 GB/64 GB model of the device was available for Rs. 19,999. If you have been thinking of getting the device, you’ll he happy to hear that the Lenovo Z2 Plus has now received a price cut.
Starting today (noon IST), the Lenovo Z2 Plus can be yours for Rs. 14,999 (32 GB) and Rs. 17,499 (64 GB). You can get both versions of the device from either Amazon or Flipkart in black or white. Additionally, the 64 GB version will also be available in quite a few retail stores across the country.
See also: Lenovo P2 brings its massive 5,100-mAh battery to India 5 days ago As a refresher, the Lenovo Z2 Plus is a rebranded version of the ZUK 2 and comes with a 5-inch Full HD display. You’ll find the Snapdragon 820 chipset under the hood alongside the already mentioned 3 or 4 GB of RAM. There is a 13 MP camera on the back with an f/2.2 aperture and phase detection autofocus. The device also features a non-removable 3,500 mAh battery, an 8 MP selfie snapper, and a fingerprint scanner. It ships with Android 6.0.1 Marshmallow on board with Lenovo’s custom skin on top.
If you’re in the market for a new smartphone and are considering getting the Lenovo Z2 Plus, head over to Amazon’s or Flipkart’s website by clicking the button below.
Buy The Lenovo Z2 Plus from Flipkart Buy The Lenovo Z2 Plus from Amazon
